moves.1. d4 d5 2. b3 Bf5 3. Bb2 Nf6 4. Nf3 e6: The Bf5 setup that my opponent uses turns out to be pretty effective.
It may have been an error to allow this.  The doubled d pawns turn out to be quite a liability later.
My pawns have gained some space, but the doubled and isolated d pawns are well-targeted by Black.
moves.24. Qf4 Rac8 25. Rac1 Rxc2 26. Rxc2 g5 2: Almost all of my play is dictated by having to protect the annoying d pawns.  If I could figure out a way to jettison them while converting to some other useful feature I would!
moves.35. Qe5 Rb8 36. Qxf4: This relieves some of the pressure on my d pawn and weakens Black's pawn structure, but Black is still equal.
moves.36... gxf4 37. Kf1 Kf8 38. Ke2 Ke8 39. K: It's going to be difficult for either side to make progress without taking dangerous chances.  A draw was agreed.  Well-played by Black, especially the way my weak pawns were targeted consistently.
